goal.util

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.util.Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements simple statistic functionality.
    Author:
    W.Pasman 11aug2010

        public Statistics(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> dataSet)
        Initializes the statistics with given set of data.
        Parameters:
        dataSet - A set of double values.
        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getData()
        Returns the data set used for this statistics.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of data elements.

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.Double d)
        Adds a new data entry to the data set.
        Parameters:
        d - The new data element.

      • merge

        public void merge(Statistics statistics)
        merge this statistics with other statistics. Effectively this means just addAll with the data from the other statistics.
        Parameters:
        statistics - The statistics that is to be merged.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks whether data set is empty.
        Returns:
        true if empty, else false.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns the size of the data set.
        Returns:
        The number of items in the data set.

      • getMean

        public java.lang.Double getMean()
        Returns the mean value of all of the data set elements.
        Returns:
        The mean of the data elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if there are 0 numbers in the data set.

      • getSum

        public java.lang.Double getSum()
        Returns the sum of the data elements.
        Returns:
        The sum of the data elements, 0 if there is no data.

      • getMinimum

        public java.lang.Double getMinimum()
        Returns the smallest data element present in the data set.
        Returns:
        The minimal data element in the data set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - when data set is empty

      • getMaximum

        public java.lang.Double getMaximum()
        Returns the largest data element.
        Returns:
        The data element with the largest value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - when data set is empty
